attributes.title: Stock Verifcation
attributes.description:
1.     Stock Verification

Findings;

·       A stock take exercise was conducted on 11 March, 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.

·       The physical stock count revealed minimal variances when compared with the system's recorded balance for almost all stock items. However, notable discrepancies were observed in the following categories:

ü  Packing Materials: Variance of +169 pieces.

ü  White Bread: Variance of +85 pieces.

ü  Utto: Variance of +5.27

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·       Strong controls on Stocks should be adhered to in order to minimize the variance.
attributes.effect: The stock is the within the set limit, indication strong controls.

value:
1. The utto is being used once per cycle on Tins.

2. The Polybags and Bread variance is within the limit.

- Less Utto is used on the Tins. 

- Will maintain strong controls on stock.

·       In the previous

Audit, the

following variances

were noted:

ü  Utto +1.6

ü  Polybags +134

ü  Bread

Stock +50.25
Previous
A stock take exercise was conducted on 11th March 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place i.e. Raw Materials, Finished Goods, Polybags & Miscellaneous.
Stock had minimal variances.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring Strong Internal Controls are Put in Place.

attributes.title: Bread Weight Check
attributes.description:
1.      Bread weight check

Findings.

·       Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed on 13 March 2025 to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

·       We had few cases of underweight Breads.

·       From the selected sample, bread Overweight were noted in

     Overweight Breads:

ü  600g Barrel White : 29% overweight

The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.recommendation: Strict adherence to set standard dough weights in order to attain standard weight bread especially on 600g Barrel White
attributes.effect:
- Few cases of underweight is an indication that production standards are adhered to.

- Overweight bread lowers yield targets hence revenue targets not realized.

value:
-  We will maintain controls on 400 and 800 Barrel White Bread.

- The market demand for 600 Barrel White is low, so it is not packed first, leading to overcooling

- We will continue maintain strong controls on 400- and 800-Barrel Bread.

- 600 Barrel White takes longer, thus requiring more water, which leads to overweight.

- Few cases of

underweight were noted in the

previous audit spot

 check.

Underweight were

spread as follows.

·       400g W- 4%, and

800g W – 1%.
Previous
Bread Weight is done for all the varieties.
Compliance was met, with no cases of underweight bread.
Operations/Production Department
To establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

attributes.title: Bread Damages Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       We reviewed the damages for the period 1 to 28 February 2025 on 13 March 2025 to determine if there were instances of excess damages beyond the set standard limits of 0.25% of total production for production damages and 2.0% of total sales for market damages.

·       Both market and production damages were maintained within the set limit as shown below;

Below is a summary table of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·       The effective controls should be maintained.
attributes.effect: Damages are maintained within the set limit indicating that controls on damages are effective and do not expose the company to losses.

value: We will improve and even reduce on damages.
We will improve & maintain strong controls.

·       Both market and production damages were maintained within the set limit.

ü  Production Damage – 0.12%.

ü  Market  Damage – 1.45%
Previous
The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within the set limits.
The production and market damages were within the set limit.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring controlled bread damages.

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       An analysis of mixing charts and summaries was done for a period of 28 days from 1 February to 28 February 2025 on 12 March 2025 to determine if the raw materials usage were as per the set BOM and if the set production standards were achieved.

·       An analysis was also performed to verify if there were any significant variances between the mixing chart summary and the SAP system.

·       The table below shows a summarized finding of the mixing chart analysis.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should work towards achieving the set production target and set consumption standards.
attributes.effect: 80.43% target achievement indicates that the branch is not meeting its production targets by 19.57%.

value: We will work toward achieving the set production target.
·       The production target is achievable; however, cutting down production led to not meeting the set target.
·       In the previous audit report, there was no material variance between system and the actual material usage and No  significant variance in bread posting was noted over the audited period.
Previous
Comparison of manual mixing charts and the SAP mixing charts was done from 1st to 28th February 2025 to find out Manual Mixing Chart was matching with SAP System.
Set Yield, Consumption was observed apart from set production target which was not achieved due to less orders and cutting down production.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure the set Yield, Consumption of Raw Materials and Production Bags is achieved.

attributes.title: Cash Count
attributes.description:
·       Verification of cash held at the cash office was done on 11 March 2025, to confirm if the cash held by the cashier tallied with book records and whether the set cash operation standards were adhered to.

·       During the cash count, the variance noted was minimal  as illustrated below;
attributes.recommendation: The Cashier should maintain strong controls by doing daily reconciliations.
attributes.effect: The immaterial variance noted in cash office is an indication that   effective controls are in place.

value: The positive trend will be maintained.
To be maintained.

·       In the previous

audit findings,

No material

variances were

noted on the

spot-check day.
Previous
Physical cash was verified on 11/03/2025 to check whether cash counted matched that on SAP balances.
Minimal cash variance suggest effective controls were put in place.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring Cash Controls are strong.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Production efficiency was calculated for a period of 28 days from 1February 2025 to 28 February 2025 on 12 March 2025. The aim was to determine if the production workers hired were achieving the set production efficiency of 4.5 bags.

·       The actual efficiency was 4.71 bags per worker, which was higher than the KPI of 4.5 bags per worker.

A summary of the analysis is shown below;

Production efficiency
attributes.recommendation: ·       The branch should continue achieving the set production efficiency.
attributes.effect: The company saved KES 15,212.4 by achieving a higher production efficiency than initially planned (105% of the target). This suggests that the company's operations are becoming more streamlined and cost-effective.

value: The set production efficiency will be maintained.
The control will be maintained.

·       Production efficiency was achieved in the

 previous audit

findings.

(4.6 bags per

worker).
Previous

This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs. Standard production efficiency is 4.5bags per staff.
Production efficiency was achieved.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring set production efficiency is adhered to.

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings.

·       Packing Efficiency was computed for period of 28 days from 1 February 2025 to 28 February 2025 on 12 March 2025 to determine whether the set company standard of 97 crates per slicer was being achieved.

·       The findings revealed that the average slicing efficiency for the period was 100.28 crates per slicer.

The table below illustrates the findings;-
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue achieving the set target of 97 Crates per Slicer.
attributes.effect: The company saved KES 6,384 by achieving a higher packing efficiency than KPI. This suggests that the company's operations are becoming more streamlined and cost-effective.

value: The controls to be maintained.
The controls will be maintained.

·       In the prior audit, Packaging

efficiency was 95.2 crates per worker which

was slightly below

the target.
Previous

·Get the total production for the 3rd shift of previous day, 1st shift, and 2nd shift of the current day, then less FOC, Less Production damages, less oven damages and less deductions (short or bread)

=Loaves to be packed.
The slicing efficiency was achieved.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure set efficiency of 97 crates per slicer is achieved.

attributes.title: Mileage Analysis
attributes.description: ·       The purpose of this audit was to assess and analyze the fuel consumption of the branch sales vehicle for the period from 1 February to 28 February 2025 done on 13 March 2025.
attributes.recommendation: Strong controls should be maintained.
attributes.effect: Higher actual efficiency to set standard implies effective controls.

value: To be maintained.
We shall maintain.

·       No previous Audit

Findings.
Previous
The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file.
Effective fuel consumption
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring that all sales vans fuel consumption is as per set standards.
